Class ConnectionWatcherActor

java.lang.Object
com.scivicslab.actoriac.cli.ConnectionWatcherActor
public class ConnectionWatcherActor extends Object
Actor that monitors the log server and triggers auto-shutdown when idle.

This actor periodically checks the log server's status and decides whether to shut it down based on:

  • Number of active TCP connections
  • Time since last activity (session creation, log writes)

Shutdown Decision Logic:

Every check interval:
  1. Check for new activity (session count changes)
  2. Get active connection count
  3. If connections == 0 AND idle time > threshold:
     â†’ Send stop message to LogServerActor
Since:
2.11.0
Author:
devteam@scivics-lab.com

    • ConnectionWatcherActor

      public ConnectionWatcherActor(com.scivicslab.pojoactor.core.ActorRef<LogServerActor> logServerActor)
      Creates a new ConnectionWatcherActor with default settings.
      Parameters:

    • ConnectionWatcherActor

      public ConnectionWatcherActor(com.scivicslab.pojoactor.core.ActorRef<LogServerActor> logServerActor, long checkIntervalSeconds, long idleThresholdSeconds, boolean verbose)
      Creates a new ConnectionWatcherActor with custom settings.
      Parameters:
      logServerActor - reference to the log server actor
      checkIntervalSeconds - interval between checks in seconds
      idleThresholdSeconds - idle time threshold in seconds
      verbose - enable verbose logging

    • stop

      public void stop()
      Stops the watcher.

    • checkAndDecide

      public void checkAndDecide()
      Performs a single check and decides whether to shut down the server. This method is called periodically by the scheduler.

    • performCheck

      private void performCheck(LogServerActor server)
      Performs the actual check logic. This runs inside the actor's context.

      public boolean isRunning()
      Checks if the watcher is currently running.
